80906624A852466BAB6EE47F845E9FB1.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and tasks using of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

37409D599F864224BE0D183C2FFA831B.description: Integrate multimedia and visual displays into presentations to clarify information, strengthen claims and evidence, and add interest.

78E52BE06A6A46728F80C9078E2AD9D8.description: Present claims and findings, emphasizing salient points in a focused, coherent manner with relevant evidence, sound valid reasoning, and well-chosen details.

531A938295E046E69A2CC45FC42F3E4A.description: Use appropriate eye contact, adequate volume, and clear pronunciation when presenting.

DCD683F87CE94DE2A719795A31ECDA05.description: Delineate a speaker’s argument and specific claims, evaluating the soundness of the reasoning and relevance and sufficiency of the evidence and identifying when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

BEFE3179D6E04E6EABCFF7A061FD0E3B.description: Analyze the purpose of information presented in a variety of media and formats and evaluate the motives (e.g., social, commercial, political) behind its presentation.

599BCA581CAD4A25B1D6B168EA35B3BA.description: Acknowledge new information expressed by others, and, when warranted, respectfully qualify or justify their own views in light of the evidence presented.

BDBC3FE171F04EDFAEBE52401A5896B4.description: Pose questions that connect the ideas of several speakers and respond to others’ questions and comments with relevant evidence, observations, and ideas.

CA7AD6C80A174491AB7ADF448645B73E.description: Follow rules for collegial discussions and decision-making and define individual roles as needed.

B0CC6F8B44634F5F938A0D2A36FC1960.description: Come to discussions prepared, having read or researched assigned material; explicitly draw on that preparation by referring to evidence on the topic, text, or issue to probe and reflect on ideas under discussion.

1EB0D53B44684B1590BAC39F503FF3D9.description: Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with a variety of partners on grade 8 topics, texts, and issues, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.

01D9EBE7A6F3482BA9E0B89E4D7E8F06.description: Use accurately grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases; gather vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

2CAEC4FF09F04C77947A2C33EF7314DF.description: Distinguish among the connotations (associations) of words with similar denotations (definitions) (e.g., bullheaded, willful, firm, persistent, resolute).

B5EA1AC17AAE4C2BAFB4C04CDDD65161.description: Use the relationship between particular words to better understand each of the words.

5F400920BDA345E6A469BA55704F6BF0.description: Understand and Interpret figurative language to provide meaning (e.g. verbal irony, puns, biblical allusions) in context.

2D2C6ED2A65448B7A5A7E7FF1205AB45.description: Demonstrate consistent and fluent understanding of figurative language, word relationships, analogies, and nuances in word meanings. Clarification: explicit instruction of  the strategies and their application is required.

C126BBC73E084B70A5F1C4BF531536C2.description: Verification of the meaning of a word or phrase (e.g., by checking the meaning in context or in a dictionary).

CF1C177AF3414DB090C717BDCD3A7E43.description: Use of dictionaries, glossaries, thesauruses both print and digital, to find the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

514F6E56B92B408AB698D2C92604FB9C.description: Use of common, grade-appropriate Greek or Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., precede, recede, secede).

E54749A1324A4451A6E0E3AEE77D57A2.description: Use of context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase. For example, analyze the word’s position, part of speech, or function in a sentence to determine specific meaning of the word and how it contributes to the meaning of the sentence or paragraph.

B21354287AE3428E9F1E550756312590.description: Use the following strategies fluently and consistently to determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or phrases based on grade 8 reading and content.  Clarification: explicit instruction of  the strategies and their application required.

A160E9FC40DB4F9E87967F00983B5DD8.description: Demonstrate proper use of the conventions of standard English grammar, punctuation, spelling, and sentence structure when writing, in both informal and academic situations. Clarification: Multiple student work samples that demonstrate the application of this benchmark is required.

C0EC2E28CFEC4E98B5DC90A32C1453F3.description: Use of correct spelling through editing and revision.

24916F1D6AD348669095A707DBDB69B1.description: Use an ellipsis to indicate an omission.

42838A5E28524FCD95CFED45591230FF.description: Use punctuation (comma, ellipsis, dash) to indicate a pause or break.

936A99734626440789CE64A323FD6804.description: Demonstrate use of the following conventions of standard English punctuation when writing for a variety of purposes and audiences.

B23E41F619BB408292BFE91A1459394E.description: Explain the function of verbals (gerunds, participles, infinitives) in writing.

B58CD79E74374A7FA819D87E0A001ABD.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate shifts in verb voice and mood.

6EC85D557205449FA1136762FA15DE9F.description: Form and use verbs in the indicative, imperative, interrogative, conditional, and subjunctive mood.

7EBC344FCAF241D7928B0187217311BE.description: Form and use verbs in the active and passive voice.

82BE37C920A3414589E2EE17504CC1A9.description: Demonstrate use of the following conventions of standard English grammar when writing or speaking.

9CFAB3FA99714B6584FEDF39B02EF2F7.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences  including for enjoyment and self-expression.

E6BFE803B13F462D8D804A622AAEA969.description: Write routinely over varying time frames and for varying purposes, and varying audiences.

8CDD90EA61854E699FEB66BF7574DC10.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research. Clarification 1: Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literature (e.g., “Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works such as the Bible, including describing how the material is rendered new”). Clarification 2: Apply grade 8 Reading standards to literary nonfiction (e.g., “Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced”).

EC437A0B0873447DB47B191DF3B9BE2C.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, using search terms effectively; assess the credibility and accuracy of each source; and quote or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others while avoiding academic dishonesty and following an appropriate format for citation.

85AAD2CAC71C407A93330B6004988935.description: Conduct short research projects to answer a question (including a self-generated question), drawing on several sources and generating additional related, focused questions that allow for multiple avenues of exploration.

F8EE48CACAF846C5B9ECFF5E6BB0E9CB.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

C781F0D9A17A44A38358EBCA8E608A6C.description: Demonstrate an understanding of ethical considerations related to the use of search engines and Artificial Intelligence (AI) in writing, including responsible sourcing and transparency. Clarification 1: Students will be able to use these tools responsibly to gather information for their writing projects. Clarification 2: Students should understand the importance of verifying and cross-referencing information obtained through these tools to ensure accuracy and reliability. Clarification 3: Students will be encouraged to explore diverse sources, considering the potential biases inherent in algorithms. Clarification 4: Students will develop an awareness of the use of these tools in their writing process and should be able to articulate how these tools contribute to their work. Clarification 5: Students will understand the concept of transparency, acknowledging when digital resources and/or AI is involved in generating or enhancing their writing.

5FBCDF9C296E408981338B7964EAB24D.description: Use technology tools to produce and publish writing and present the relationships between information and ideas efficiently, as well as to interact and collaborate with others.

644014C2D2A04991B3E689CCDD7C9A95.description: With guidance and support from teachers, peers and digital resources, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach, focusing on how well purpose and audience have been addressed.                                                                                         Clarification: 1: Instructional use of such digital tools such as the internet, grammerly.com, spell- and grammar-check, plagiarism checkers, generative artifical intelligence (AI) to support more fluent student writing but not to replace original student writing.

22254C8FA2B54D70B2584360E38614F4.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)

69C0C4EF142D450F9CE6C6FE4B52D8C1.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. Clarification 1:  Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically. Clarification 2: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, and reflection, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters. Clarification 3: Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence, signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another, and show the relationships among experiences and events. Clarification 4: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events. Clarification 5: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

0A29DE01F915436186E788B45A758168.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences. Clarification 1:  Engage and orient the reader by establishing a context and point of view and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds naturally and logically. Clarification 2: Use narrative techniques, such as dialogue, pacing, description, and reflection, to develop experiences, events, and/or characters. Clarification 3: Use a variety of transition words, phrases, and clauses to convey sequence, signal shifts from one time frame or setting to another, and show the relationships among experiences and events. Clarification 4: Use precise words and phrases, relevant descriptive details, and sensory language to capture the action and convey experiences and events. Clarification 5: Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

830709A41CD34122B9914CCEB455F923.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content. Clarification 1: Introduce a topic clearly, previewing what is to follow; organize ideas, concepts, and information into broader categories; include formatting (e.g., headings), graphics (e.g., charts, tables), and multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension. Clarification 2: Develop the topic with relevant, well-chosen facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples. Clarification 3: Use appropriate and varied transitions to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among ideas and concepts.                                                                                                                           Clarification 4: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic. Clarification 5: Establish and maintain a formal style. Clarification 6: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from and supports the information or explanation presented.

1D8AF371BE2048E3B7512DE2297BF8FF.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence. Clarification 1: IIntroduce claim(s), acknowledge and distinguish the claim(s) from alternate or opposing claims, and organize the reasons and evidence logically. Clarification 2:  Support claim(s) with logical reasoning and relevant evidence, using accurate, credible sources and demonstrating an understanding of the topic or text. Clarification 3: Use words, phrases, and clauses to create cohesion and clarify the relationships among claim(s), counterclaims, reasons, and evidence. Clarification 4: Establish and maintain a formal style. Clarification 5: Provide a concluding statement or section that follows from the argument presented.

21E12DD1BA094A52A403C653EF7028C1.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poems, at grade level and/or developmentally appropriate content.

A6CD58E3C556472AB14B8E3CB6C42F61.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

72B8386FC8004BB0B3ADCF9CCB37F332.description: Analyze how a modern work of fiction draws on themes, patterns of events, or character types from myths, traditional stories, or religious works such as the Bible, including describing how the material is rendered new.

4B95FEC0879F4957AD0DC9D82A696DAE.description: Analyze the extent to which a filmed or live production of a story or drama stays faithful to or departs from the text or script, evaluating the choices made by the director or actors.

32BD0ACB3DE54A4581A6742E087A04CC.description: Analyze how differences in the points of view of the characters and the audience or reader (e.g., created through the use of dramatic irony) create such effects as suspense or humor.

B8A6E28E70D647088746AA90F4C86F67.description: Compare and contrast the structure of two or more texts and analyze how the differing structure of each text contributes to its meaning and style.

89DA9021814B454E932B1B109E371A22.description: Analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

7DFDDFB5681E489A98F0F5B2CDF5C85A.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative and connotative meanings.

0247243FBD7D4C4783ED9A7DFF731F1D.description: Summarize a given text including theme, conflict, and resolution that is distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

EA2FBC5E6F574190A2B4197F1F6AC35C.description: Analyze how particular lines of dialogue or incidents in a story or drama propel the action, reveal aspects of a character, or provoke a decision.

7A30C25415A44431AA7AB89C0B68936F.description: Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.

332418392B534EB889BE71AB16A06449.description: Determine a theme or central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to the characters, setting, and plot.

B8D9432117F74182AC9CADA4B9C46D25.description: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literary nonfiction text complexity band proficiently at grade level and/or developmentally appropriate content.

C0D121BD15054C388FDDD73E33E6BADB.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

5DC47394F42D4E1581D13C94274BB129.description: Analyze a case in which two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same topic and identify where the texts disagree on matters of fact or interpretation.

BF87C5BF00364C63A00E16F97EC57340.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient; recognize when irrelevant evidence is introduced.

34327700ADB8440F88DE542F31B5DCF0.description: Evaluate the advantages and disadvantages of using different mediums (e.g., print or digital text, video, multimedia) to present a particular topic or idea.

BD38596FF7064D8192D78CFA1578F591.description: Determine an author’s perspective or purpose in a text and analyze how the author acknowledges and responds to conflicting evidence or viewpoints.

24905787A97F4B8BAB44529398C541B5.description: Analyze in detail the structure of a specific paragraph in a text, including the role of particular sentences in developing and refining a key concept.

EB51D8DE5E094E58ABC42E42CC98B727.description: Analyze the impact of specific word choices on meaning and tone, including analogies or allusions to other texts.

AAA49BF33FAE4BEC8B1D5ABC1B36FCAD.description: Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text, including figurative, connotative, and technical meanings.

21E01960A668488BABFE38963A9939FD.description: Summarize a given text including theme, conflict, and resolution that is distinct from personal opinions or judgments.

29587683BA0943FEAC42DC43D059CA09.description: Analyze how a text makes connections among and distinctions between individuals, ideas, or events (e.g., through comparisons, analogies, or categories).

10997135BB0E455D96985E5A792BF874.description: Determine a central idea of a text and analyze its development over the course of the text, including its relationship to supporting ideas.

D107CD56E9BA48C3A07E6210654E0DC7.description: Cite the textual evidence that most strongly supports an analysis of what the text says explicitly as well as inferences drawn from the text.
